meanings.definition: Capable of being ruled or governed.
meanings.sent1: The classroom was rulable with the teacher's clear instructions.
meanings.sent2: The new software is rulable, making it easy for anyone to use.
meanings.sent3: The rulable puppy followed every command, even rolling over on cue.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a rulable kingdom, where logic and reason reigned supreme.
meanings.sent5: The rulable nature of the traffic flow made the commute stress-free.

meanings.definition: Able to be controlled or regulated.
meanings.sent1: The temperature in the room was rulable thanks to the thermostat.
meanings.sent2: The volume on the TV was rulable, allowing for a comfortable viewing experience.
meanings.sent3: The rulable garden hose made watering the plants a breeze.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were rulable, never getting out of hand even in stressful situations.
meanings.sent5: The rulable speed of the fan kept the room cool without being too loud.
